source: StackOverflow Data Dump (2024). Badge rules from https://stackoverflow.com/help/badges
description: A relational dataset from StackOverflow containing 255K users, 334K posts, 463K badges, 1.3M votes, 624K comments, and 1.2M post history events. Badge Class values: 0=Gold, 1=Silver, 2=Bronze. RelBench strips badge Name and TagBased columns, retaining only (Id, UserId, Date).

badges.description: Badge awards to users. Each row is one badge instance awarded to a user at a specific time. In the original SO data dump this table includes Name, Class, and TagBased columns, but RelBench retains only Id, UserId, and Date.

columns.UserId: FK to users — the user who earned this badge
columns.Date: Timestamp when the badge was awarded

badges.note: Class (0=Gold, 1=Silver, 2=Bronze) is the prediction target in the badges-class task. Name and TagBased columns are stripped by RelBench.

posts.description: Questions and answers. PostTypeId=1 for questions, PostTypeId=2 for answers.

columns.ParentId: FK to posts — for answers, the question Id
columns.OwnerDisplayName: Display name at time of posting
columns.Title: Question title (null for answers)

votes.description: Votes on posts. VoteTypeId encodes the vote action.

columns.PostId: FK to posts — the post being voted on
FK to posts — the post being commented on
columns.UserDisplayName: Display name at time of commenting

columns.PostId: FK to posts — the edited post

badge_rules.description: Official StackOverflow badge award criteria. Badge class: Gold=0, Silver=1, Bronze=2. These rules are the ground truth that the badges-class task asks models to predict, but RelBench strips the badge Name column, making the rules unobservable from the data alone.

badge_rules.class_distribution_insight: Bronze badges dominate because (1) most badge types are bronze (47 bronze vs 30 silver vs 18 gold), (2) many bronze badges are awarded once per qualifying post (e.g., Nice Answer at 10+ score is far more common than Great Answer at 100+), and (3) many bronze badges are trivially earned (Supporter=first upvote, Informed=read tour page). This explains why MODE(Class) = Bronze for every user-activity bin.
badge_rules.rule_structure_insight: Most badge rules follow threshold patterns on observable quantities: post scores (10/25/100), view counts (1000/2500/10000), activity counts (10/80/500 edits/flags), or temporal patterns (30/100 consecutive days). The gold/silver/bronze progression typically uses 3x-10x threshold multipliers. Since RelBench strips the badge Name, predicting class requires inferring which threshold was crossed from the user's activity history at the badge award time.
